title: Sofia Richie feels 'left out' around Kourtney Kardashian
text:
Scott Disick reveals girlfriend Sofia Richie feels ‘left out’ around his ex Kourtney (Picture: E!)

Scott Disick was left feeling a little flustered (and not in a good way) when he took a trip to Finland with both his girlfriend, Sofia Richie, and baby mama, Kourtney Kardashian.

Kourtney and Scott share three kids together – Mason, nine, Penelope, seven, and Reign, four – and dated for nearly a decade, before finally calling time on their relationship for good in 2015.

Despite their split, Kourtney and Scott have remained good pals and Scott has firmly stayed part of the Kardashian family furniture.

He has been dating Sofia, 21, for the last two years and she’s becoming more and more involved with his family. So much so, that she features in the latest episode of Keeping Up With The Kardashians that sees Sofia and Scott join Kourtney and the kids in Finland.

Kourtney had suggested Scott bring Sofia along, but he admitted that the model often feels ‘left out’ when she’s around the exes.

He said: ‘I never want to miss out on anything when it includes the kids. The past six to eight months, we’ve been on a couple of trips where it’s been Kourtney, Sofia, the kids… and it’s been great.

‘But, Sofia mentioned to me that she feels a little left out, so I have to be careful not to overstep anyone’s boundaries and make anyone feel left out.’

Conscious of how Sofia feels, he added: ‘I don’t want her to feel out of place, I don’t want her to feel like she’s not as comfortable as I am.’

Scott said he wanted to be ‘cautious of everyone’s feelings’ but admitted it can be hard being around both Sofia and Kourtney at the same time – given his history with Kourt.

‘Sometimes you have so many inside jokes or inside things with somebody you’ve known for so long, even if you’re not romantically with them, you don’t really know how to act,’ he said.

Scott and Sofia have been dating for the last two years (Picture: Getty Images)

‘It is definitely a really hard and awkward situation, and I just feel bad. At the end of the day, I want the people I love in my life to be happy.’

While the trip turned out to be an all-round success, there were a few awkward moments that led to Kourtney grilling Scott on their unconventional setup.

She was annoyed that he’d left with Sofia early during a trip to Santa’s workshop and told the Flip It Like Disick star he’s putting ‘too much pressure’ on himself to please everyone.

The episode will give fans an inside look at Scott’s relationship with Sofia, as the couple usually tend to keep their romance pretty private.

Speaking about Scott earlier this year, Sofia told Tatler magazine: ‘I think a lot of people think they have to prove their relationships through social media and I’m just happy being private about my relationship.

‘It’s not like I won’t post pictures about it, but I like having my little private life.’
